parliamentary.service.title: Parliamentary Service
parliamentary.service.para: Elected to the House of Representatives for Bowman, Queensland, 2004, 2007, 2010 and 2013.

parliamentary.appointments.title: Parliamentary Appointments
parliamentary.appointments.para: Government Representative, Australian National Commission for UNESCO from 2005.

committee.service.title: Committee Service
committee.service.para: House of Representatives Standing: Communications, Information Technology and the Arts from 1.12.04 to 17.10.07; Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Affairs from 28.2.06 to 19.7.10; Employment and Workplace Relations from 11.3.08 to 10.11.08; Health from 4.12.13; Indigenous Affairs from 25.9.14.
Joint Statutory: Public Accounts and Audit from 1.12.04 to 17.10.07; Human Rights from 4.12.13 to 25.9.14.
Joint Select: Australia Fund Establishment from 25.9.14 (Chair from 14.11.14).

parliamentary.party.positions.title: Parliamentary Party Positions
parliamentary.party.positions.para: Shadow Parliamentary Secretary for Regional Health Services and Indigenous Health from 14.9.10 to 18.9.13.

party.positions.title: Party Positions
party.positions.para: Member, Liberal Party Wynnum Manly Branch 2001-03.
Member, Liberal Party Cleveland Branch from 2003.

quals.work.pre.parliament.title: Qualifications and Occupation before entering Federal Parliament
quals.work.pre.parliament.para: MBBS (Qld), DRCOG (London), MPubPol (NTU), MPA (Harvard), MPhil (Syd.), FRANZCO.
Landmine clearer, rigger and gymnasium manager 1992.
Senior ophthalmology registrar and Chief Executive Officer, Friends In Deed Organisation (FIDO) 1999.
World Bank consultant and travel writer 2000.

publications.title: Publications
publications.para: Lets go - Turkey (contribution, ed. ES Daniel and SK Quinlan), New York: St Martins Press, 2000.
Founding editor, Kennedy School Review, Harvard University, 2000.

electorate.title: Electorate
electorate.para: Location: south-east Brisbane; it includes the suburbs of Alexandra Hills, Birkdale, Capalaba, Cleveland, Mount Cotton, Ormiston, Redland Bay, Sheldon, Thorneside, Thornlands, Victoria Point and Wellington Point. It also includes North Stradbroke Island.
Industries: farming, retail, light industry and tourism.
State electorates: Bowman includes the Queensland Legislative Assembly electorates of Capalaba and Cleveland, and parts of Mansfield and Redlands.
